Subject: Why Outlook thinks Junit postings are spam (slightly off topic)
Date: Wed, 23 Jan 2002 14:50:07 -0000
MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=36002397

Having recently started receiving a lot of spam mail at my work e-mail
address I have been experimenting with Outlook's junk e-mail option.  This
is a rather crude spam filter because I still get the stuff.

But I noticed that lots (but not all) of the Junit postings were being
routed into the spambox.  When I investigated I discovered they all had this
in common:

>>Tiny Wireless Camera under $80!
>>Order Now! FREE VCR Commander!
>>Click Here - Only 1 Day Left!
>>http://us.click.yahoo.com/nuyOHD/7.PDAA/yigFAA/NhFolB/TM

Presumably added by our glorious and generous sponsors in order to defray
the cost of supporting this list.   That is fine and I don't have any
argument with it.  But isn't it a little counter productive if it results in
untold e-mails never being read by the recipients?

Anyway, this "Only 1 Day Left!" offer has been appended to e-mails for
several weeks now, so either Yahoo! 's marketing is, um, inexact or people
are reusing existing e-mails for new postings, in which case it might be an
idea to trim the verbiage from the bottom - which might explain why not all
the junit postings get treated as spam.

I'm waiting to see whether I receive this.

rgds, APC
